alert.note: Alert for Hancock; Harrison; Jackson (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 13 at 11:21PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Harrison, northeastern Hancock and Jackson Counties through 1215 AM CDT... At 1120 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles west of Wade to 6 miles northeast of Diamondhead. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Gulfport, Biloxi, Ocean Springs, Long Beach, Moss Point, Bay St. Louis, St. Martin, Diamondhead, Escatawpa, Gautier, D`iberville, Wade, Latimer, Big Point, Lyman, Saucier, Helena, Gulf Hills, Hurley and Vancleave. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Mississippi between mile markers 16 and 76. Interstate 110 in Mississippi between mile markers 1 and 4. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for southern Mississippi.
